We shouldn't still be fighting for the rights that our ancestors and elders sacrificed so much for, but here we are. Rev. Martin Luther King did everything he could to fight for equity, access, and inclusion. It's our turn do the same.

Civil rights came from relentless and fearless leaders who dared to challenge the norm even when it meant putting their lives on the line. 

In 2022 systemic racial oppression presents itself differently than in 1962, but it's still here. Again, we must protect the right to vote.

Maybe now the nation realizes the importance of investments in our public schools. It‚Äôs why we introduced a Green New Deal for Public Schools back in June. 

No easy or perfect answers. We need collaboration, empathy, and trust to get through this together.

This is not about teachers versus students. Both need care. And in my opinion as a 20 year educator and former middle school principal, we need vaccines, testing, masks, more teachers, and remote options all at the same time. In addition to quality HVAC systems in every school.
This is not just about policy. It is about trust. And trust has been broken which makes collaboration almost impossible. Which is needed now more than ever.

We also need a pipeline of teachers and subs. Congress passed the American Rescue Plan in March which sent historic relief to school districts. That money can be spent on the best remote resources, teacher pipelines, and school mental health supports our kids desperately need.

Vaccines, testing, and masks work. And we are calling on Congress to do more. 

Schools should also consider a remote option indefinitely. Some kids and families prefer remote options especially during this COVID surge. There are quality remote options available.

I also strongly encourage all families to opt their children in to COVID testing by the DOE. Yes, children are low risk, but even unvaccinated children can end up seriously ill or worse. They can also transmit the virus to someone more vulnerable.

Kids need in person learning, but if teachers are out sick and there are no substitutes, children‚Äôs learning suffers. 

I strongly encourage families to vaccinate themselves and their kids, and get a booster too. Vaccines are safe and continue to save lives.

Students aren‚Äôt okay if teachers aren‚Äôt okay. And in my 20 years of experience as an educator, the vast majority of teachers wanna be there for their students. 

But they also wanna be respected.  And they should be. 

I have a lot to say about this ‚¨áÔ∏è
